sentences.sContent: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.sCn: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.sContent: His breathing was slow and regular.
Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.sCn: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.sContent: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.sCn: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.sContent: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.sCn: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

synos.tran: 定期的；有规律的；合格的；[植]整齐的
常客；正式队员；中坚分子

phrases.pCn: 常规性的锻炼；经常操练，按时训练
正则表达式；正规表达式
定期航行；定期服务；正常业务

remMethod.val: regul( = reg， 统治) + ar → 受统治的 → 规则的

words.tran: 定期地；有规律地；整齐地；匀称地
调整；使有秩序；使合法化
使合法化；使有秩序（等于regularize）

trans.tranCn: 定期的；有规律的；合格的；整齐的；普通的
trans.tranOther: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

trans.tranCn: 常客；正式队员；中坚分子
trans.tranOther: someone who often goes to the same bar, restaurant etc or who takes part in an activity very often
